moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. d3 Bb4 4. Bd2 d5 5: considered as an inaccuracy by the computer.
moves.6... Nxc3 7. Bxc3 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 O-O 9. g: computer considers black as much better than white. Though, I like this kind of situation; white dominates the clear squares, threats to double c pawns and black has no specific threat. In 2 moves, I am completely developped.
moves.13... Ne6 14. Rab1 Nc5 15. Rb4 Bf5: Now, white seems much better, according to the computer, but I finally saw a threat on d3... and panicked...
moves.16. Nd2: computers proposed e4. I thought of it, but didn't believe in it. I already knew I would lose a pawn here
moves.16... Rfd8 17. Nb3 Nxd3 18. exd3 Bxd3: here comes rokk + 2 pawn for a bishop and a knight
moves.19. Qc1 Bxf1 20. Qxf1: the idea to take back with the queen was already to point on the threat on c6 and prepare the queen to go on c4, whenever...
moves.20... Qe7: i am not sure the threat has been seen by black
moves.21... Rd7 22. Nxc6 bxc6 23. Bxc6: getting back the pawn... but I admit it is mostly due to black mistake on move 20.
moves.23... Rc8 24. Bxd7 Qxd7 25. Rc4: now I want to gain a move for my queen. I hoped for him to take
moves.25... Rb8 26. Rb4: here, if he takes, I reunite 2 pawns...
moves.27. Qb5: Now i try to gain an advantage for a3 and c3: if we exchange, I have considerable possibilities as my rook is much more mobile for a few move: his has to wait his king to get free from corridor mate.
moves.29. Rxe4: ok, I grap it. I have not seen any trap
moves.29... g6 30. Re8+ Rxe8 31. Qxe8+: Now my plan is much more simpler, as i can just act to exchange the queens. My king is not too far from c3.
moves.31... Kg7 32. Qe5+ Kh6: woops, this is bad! last huge mistake, the exchange is almost inevitable.
moves.33. Qf4+ Kg7 34. Qd4+ Qxd4 35. cxd4: central pawn, king close... it is a classical final.
moves.35... Kf6 36. Kf3 Ke6 37. Ke4 f5+ 38. Kd: to keep the king off e4
moves.39... g5 40. h3: computers considers this as an inaccuracy, and prefers g4.
moves.40... h5 41. g4 hxg4 42. hxg4 fxg4 43. f: king passed... the rest is a formality
moves.46... Kb4 47. d5 Kxa4 48. d6 Kb3 49. d7:
computers proposes a mate in 5: instead of the move here:
51 Kd3 a2
52 Qb8+ Ka3 
53 Kc4 threatening mate on b3 ... a1=N (if a1=Q, Qb3 mates)
54 Qb1 Nc2 (only move)
55 Qb3# cute mate.
moves.51... Kb2 52. Qd1: i disconsidered another forced mate in 5 here.
resigns... well, although I could have finished sooner, there was no doubt about the end for a long time. Strange game, because of the two  R+2p = B+N :-)
